item.title: Galliard Homes preparing to polite our pond, 29th November
item.description:
Galliard Homes keep putting salt in the carpark surface, knowing full well that all surface water is collected via a multi drainage system and feeds into the pond in Bromley Palace Park. They have contaminated the pond three times now. Twice with washing machine suds and last week with salt. Prevention is needed. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Galliard Homes have vandalised a tree subject to a TPO, 29th November
item.description:
In early April Galliard Homes chopped down a 300 year old tree at the entrance to The St Blaise Building. This caused great concern and upset from the local residents. A TPO request was made to protect the rest of the tree and in early May a Tree Preservation Order was granted. Reference No. 515931 (applied for on 21/04/2025, granted 02/05/2025). Th local community have been monitoring the tree which has been beautifully coming back to life, more recently with about 30 long breaches of around six foot in length. It was lovely to see its recovery. I was walking past this morning and the tree has now been unlawfully cut down again by Galliard Homes. What is the point of is applying for and being granted tree preservation orders if they don’t actually protect the trees? I am disgusted that this poor tree has been hacked back to almost nothing yet again. Please please do something about this as I don’t know how many times the tree can survive this type of abuse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paid for garden waste not collected still !!, 29th November
item.description:
Your message read : Wednesday, 26th November, at 6:51am The contents of your container were frozen, so we were unable to empty it. Please leave it in your usual collection place and a team will return this week to empty. It’s Saturday 29th and most people want to do gardening this weekend but our bins we pay for to be collected are STILL full and the end of the week has passed. I called in a spoke to a man who was no help whatsoever yesterday! What are we all paying for. We understand thee team had an issue, but them if you know it’s cold use common sense and re schedule the collecting time so the bins can defrost!! It’s not rocket science
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish up and down our road, 29th November
item.description:
Poplar Road is currently used as a dumping ground for rubbish - there is rubbish up and down the street; fly tipped rubbish is outside nearly every house the road. One street over is Ferndene road which is very expensive and it is pristine. The difference in street scapes is notable and awful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poplar Road, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily flytipping of rubbish, 29th November
item.description:
This is happening at night every one or two days. The same person or couple dump their rubbish in several carrier bags opposite 53 Shifford Path rather than using the visible buns 20 metres away. Ongoing for over a month. They choose to do this at night as not to be seen. Vermin and wind carry the rubbish up Shifford Path making a right mess for all. The bags have been ripped open by foxes and one bag was full of used menstruation pads. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wynell Road, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
